result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Quinard M Jackson

records.addlTxt: Transcript of February 4, 2016 Sentencing Hearing

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Cases 15CF237, 15CM147, 15CM253, 15CF271 and 15CM219 called together at 2:39pm [mo]

Defendant Quinard M Jackson in court, in custody with Attorney John Vernon Rhiel.   ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Teuber verifies victim rights compliance

Sentencing Arguments given by Counsel
Statement made by Mr. Jackson

Upon direction of the Court, the Clerk contacts the Child Support Agency to inquire of Mr. Jackson's current child support payment status
Atty. Antholine appears in the Courtroom at 3:41pm
With permission of Mr. Jackson, the Court questions Atty. Antholine as to case 14FA113
Atty. Antholine exits the Courtroom at 3:45pm


As to Case 15CM219, the Court sentences the Defendant to:
--serve 135 days in the County Jail, WITHOUT Huber, this sentence is to commence FORTHWITH
--pay court costs plus $33 in subpoena fees, to be converted to Civil Judgement


As to Case 15CF271, Count #1  the Court sentences Defendant to:
--serve 1 year in Jefferson County Jail, WITHOUT Huber privileges; to be served consecutive to the sentence in 15CM219
--pay costs of $268 plus $250 DNA surcharge plus $100 Domestic Abuse Surcharge= $618,  to be converted to Civil Judgement

As to Case 15CF271, Counts #9 and #10, the Court withholds sentence and places the Defendant on Probation for a term of 3 years 


As to Case 15CF237, Counts #1, #2, and #3, with Court withholds sentence and places the Defendant on Probation for a term on 5 years


As to Case 15CF237, Count #5, the Court withholds sentence and places the Defendant on Probation for a term of 2 years

Probation Conditions as to Counts 9 and 10 in Case 15CF271 and Case 15CF237:
--Certified Batterers' Treatment and Intervention Programming and follow through with treatment recommendations
--any other assessment, treatment or counseling per Agent
--No Contact with: Shantavia Armstrong, unless approved by DOC Agent and JCHS
--no acts or threats of violence
--no possession or ingestion of alcohol
--no presence in bars, taverns, or liquor stores
--No contact with any of Shatavia Armstrong's children, unless approved by Ms. Armstrong, Human Services, DOC Agent, Case Manager and GAL(if under CHIPS order)
--no possession of any dangerous weapons or ammunition
--As to Case 15CF271, Count #9: to pay costs of $268 plus $250 DNA surcharge
--As to Case 15CF271, Count #10:to pay costs of $268 plus $250 DNA surcharge
--to pay subpoena fees in the amount of $205
--As to Case 15CF237, Count #1:to pay costs of $268 plus $250 DNA surcharge
--As to Case 15CF237,Count #2:to pay costs of $268 plus $250 DNA surcharge
--As to Case 15CF237,Count #3:to pay costs of $268 plus $250 DNA surcharge
--As to Case 15CF237,Count #5: to pay costs of $243 plus $200 DNA surcharge


The Court determines that Mr. Jackson has already provided a DNA sample and does not order another
The Court will determine sentence credit on a later date. 

Felony/Firearm warnings given
recess: 4:15pm
Review at 02-04-2016 02:30 pm
Criminal Case Settlement
from non-parties in support of the defendant and Wage Statements submitted by Attorney Rhiel

Cases 15CF237, 15CF271, 15CM147, 15CM219 & 15CM253 called together at 4:05 pm [Clerk SH]
Defendant Quinard M Jackson in court, in-custody, with Attorney John Vernon Rhiel. ADA Brookellen Teuber appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

15CM219:
Constitutional rights given; plea of "No Contest" entered; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders JOC entered.
On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Cases 15CM147 & 15CM253, jeopardy attaches and further prosecution is barred

15CF237: 
On Motion of the State, the Court strikes weapon enhancer on Counts #2 & #3

Constitutional rights given; plea of "No Contest" entered on Counts #1, #2, #3 & #5; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders JOC entered.
On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses all remaining counts, further prosecution is barred and jeopardy attaches

Court informs parties that given the latesness of the day, It will arrange for a sentencing date to allow parties full opportunity to arguments
Recess: 4:28 pm

Defendant Quinard M Jackson in court, in custody with Attorney John Vernon Rhiel.   ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.

Cases 15CM147, 15CM219, 15CM253 and 15CF237 called together at 3:12pm [mo]
Defendant Quinard M Jackson in court, in custody with Attorney Whitney Hagemann on behalf of Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa.   DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.

As to Case 15CF237(Arraignment occurs):

Mr. Jackson waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--the charges and maximum penalties are recited
--pleas of "not guilty" entered on all counts
--no demand for speedy trial at this time

As to all cases:
Atty. Hagemann requests that all cases be scheduled for a joint pretrial conference.
--no objection from DA Happ

recess: 3:19pm

Status conference at 09-01-2015 02:45 pm

Cases 15CM147 and 15CM219 called together at 10:30am [mo]
Defendant Quinard M Jackson in court with Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa.   ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Hall verifies victim rights compliance for both files

Atty. De La Rosa indicates that resolution has not met, requests a PTC and STC

On the State's 7/30/15 Motion for Bond Modification: 
--Atty. De La Rosa opposes the Motions for Bond Modification
--The Court reviews the State's Motion for Bond Modification
--ADA Hall refers to Statute 969.08; the Court reviews
--Argument given by Atty. De La Rosa
--The Court finds that there has been violations to conditions of release; gives basis
--The Court grants the State's Motion for Bond Modification

In Case 15CM147: The Court imposes a $500 cash bond, with conditions as previously imposed

In Case 15CM219: The Court imposes a $1000 cash bond, with conditions as previously imposed

Atty. De La Rosa does not request a speedy Trial at this time; requests that these cases be scheduled with Mr. Jackson's other cases. 
recess: 10:56am

NEXT: Status on both cases on 9/1/15 at 2:45pm

[MK] case called at 3:41pm. 
Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa in court.  ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.
This case is scheduled for FSSC today and for Jury Trial later this week.  
Attorney De La Rosa does not have information on why Mr. Jackson does not appear today. 
The Court notes that Mr. Jackson provided the Muskegon, Michigan address when he signed his Bond on May 1st and that the signed Bond was received by the Clerk of Counts Office on May 4th.  On that same date, Notices of Hearing for today's FSSC and for the Jury Trial were mailed to Mr. Jackson at the Watertown address, not at his listed Muskegon, Michigan address.  Therefore the Court will not issue a warrant for the non-appearance today.  The Court removes the Jury Trial and instead sets the case for Status Conference on June 29th at 9:00am. ---notice is to be sent to the address provided on the Bond in Muskegon, MI.  
recess 3:48pm.

NEXT:  Status Conference on June 29th at 9:00am- mail notice to the Muskegon, MI address

Case called at 2:35pm [mo]
Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa in court.  ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant, Quinard Jackson does not appear. 
The Court's Judicial Assistant provided the Court with a telephone message that indicated that Mr. Jackson has just learned of today's hearing date since his mail was sent to his Michigan address; Mr. Jackson requests that Atty De La Rosa to call him with the results of the hearing. 

With no objection from either party, The Court waives Mr. Jackson's appearance.

On the State's 5/11/15 Motion to Impeach with Priors:
--No objection from Atty De La Rosa
--The Court grants the State's Motion to Impeach with Priors
--For purposes of Trial Mr. Jackson has one prior conviction

On the State's 5/11/15 Motion in Limine:
--No Objection from Atty De La Rosa
--The Court grants the State's Motion in Limine 

On the State's 5/11/15 Notice of Intent to Admit Statements: 
--No objection from Atty De La Rosa
--The Court grants the State's Notice of Intent to Admit Statements

The Court notes that Atty. De La Rosa has submitted a Demand for Discovery and inquires of Atty. De La Rosa whether he has received the Discovery from the State. 
Atty. De La Rosa indicates that he has not received photographs.
ADA Teuber indicates that the State will contact the responsible police station.
The Court orders the State is to provide Atty. De La Rosa the Discovery by June 8, 2015 at 4:00pm
recess: 2:46pm
Attorney Jeffrey De La Rosa

Reserve Judge Mawdsley presiding for Branch II 1:15 Intake: 
[MK] case called at 1:35pm. 
Defendant Quinard M Jackson appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody. with Attorney Yelena Zarwell (PD will appoint counsel).  ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.  

On agreement of counsel, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 

Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited. 
Plea of "not guilty" entered; speedy trial demanded by the Defense

The Court requires a $1,000  signature bond, with conditions:
--no contact with Shantavia Armstrong; this condition is excepted for Mr. Jackson to return to the residence one time, accompanied by law enforcement, to retrieve personal belongings
--no acts or threats of violence against anyone
recess 1:40pm. 


NEXT: (1) Pretrial Conference on 5/27/15 at 2:20pm.    (2) schedule FSSC and Jury Trial within sixty days
